dct_title_s: [Title in Greek] = INDEX GEOGRAPHICUS TUM VETERIS TUM NOVAE COGNITAE TERRAE Nunc primum Typis Graecis propositus et. Obsequiose dicatus Serenisso; ac Pysso. Dño, ac Principi Totius Walachiae D. Joanni Constantino Bassaraba Woevondae à Crysantho Presbytero, et Apostolici, ac Sanctissimi Hierosolymarum Patriachalis Throni Archimandrita Ev ∏alabiw 1700 Patavii 1700
dct_description_sm: World map published on two sheets with Greek lettering. The author, Presbyter Chrysanthos, was the Patriarch of Jerusalem. It is dedicated to John Constantine Bessaraba whose portrait and coat of arms sit above the two hemispheres. The maps are encircled by notes in Greek, astronomical diagrams, and navigational instruments.
California as an island with broad, indented northern coast; southern portion is elongated and narrow. Labelled as California in Greek.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
